ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 7 hours
3 - 6 hours, depend on the assignment.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: In general, I really enjoyed this course. We had a great (small) group of students and the discussions were generally engaging. I think that the course would work really well in a small (capped at 15) round-table seminar style course focused more on discussion and a bit less on the traditional lecture-style.
Very informative course.
Comprehensive. However, I expect more physiological and pathological details about heart disease and stroke.
All good
Great course, allowed me to learn according to my interests.
It is a good course

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  Amazing teacher.
Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  And excellent and charming professor.
Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  Prof. Lichtman is helpful, humorous and enthusiastic.
Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  Excellent, co-operative, great teacher
Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  She is a good teacher
Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  Excellent professor. Loved this class.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Summary of the epidemiological issues related to stroke and heart disease. A course that will force you to critically analyze all of the potential risk factors for CVD/stroke. This course really made me think about some of the larger, system-level issues that can impact these diseases as well.
Would recommend.
It deserves your time.
It's a seminar-styled class. Absence is not recommended since it's a small class.You'll need to engage in the class a lot, but it's really fun!
Yes, will certainly recommend. A course that let's you learn according to your interests and applying concepts of Epi.
Recommended
